text: Sigurgeir Sigurðsson (3 August 1890 - 13 October 1953) was an Icelandic prelate who was Bishop of Iceland from 1939 to 1953 . He was the father of Bishop Pétur Sigurgeirsson, a later successor. ==Biography== Sigurðsson was born on August 3, 1890 in Eyrarbakki, Iceland. His parents were Sigurður Eiríksson and Svanhildur Sigurðardóttir. He was educated in Reykjavík in 1913 and graduated with theology from the University of Iceland in February 1917. From 1917 till 1918 he served as assistant to the Reverend Magnús Jónsson in Ísafjörður and was ordained priest on October 7 in Reykjavik Cathedral by Bishop Jón Helgason. In 1918 he became parish priest of Ísafjörður. He went to Denmark and Germany in 1928 to study. In the winter of 1937 and 1938 he travelled to London, Cambridge and Oxford."Sigurgeir Sigurðsson", Timarit.is. Retrieved on 12 July 2019. Sigurðsson was elected Bishop of Iceland in 1938 and was consecrated bishop on June 25, 1939. He travelled extensively and represented Iceland on numerous meetings and assemblies around the world. He also received numerous awards for his work. His wife was Guðrún Pétursdóttir from Seltjarnarnes. He died on October 13, 1953.Íslendingar, Merkir.
